definition: to rely on sth (for support etc)/to depend on
to depend on/to comply with or listen to sb/according to/in the light of
to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)

sentences.english: They rely on police and media pressure to reform such businesses, he added.
sentences.chinese: 他们依靠警方和媒体压力来改革此类营生，他说。

sentences.english: Diagnosis was established on clinical findings and the barium enema examination.
sentences.chinese: 诊断主要依靠临床表现和钡剂灌肠透视。

sentences.english: Their wealth depends on China, their security on America.
sentences.chinese: 他们的财富依靠中国，安全却依靠美国。

sentences.english: Their wealth depends on China, their security on America.
sentences.chinese: 他们的财富依靠中国，安全却依靠美国。

sentences.english: And it's not enough to just depend on books in the proccess of learning.
sentences.chinese: 对于其学习过程仅仅依靠书本及培训是远远不够的。

sentences.english: Can We Rely on Non-Christian Views of Justice?
sentences.chinese: 我们能依靠非基督教观的法官？

sentences.english: The tent-shaped huts are made out of logs hammered together, which rest on floating barrels.
sentences.chinese: 那些帐篷状的棚屋由原木捶钉而成并依靠浮筒漂浮。

sentences.english: In the Asian countries, most people rely on rice as their staple grain.
sentences.chinese: 在亚洲国家，多数人依靠大米为食粮。

sentences.english: The outcome is decisions that feed the acquisition process, or reassignment of resources.
sentences.chinese: 结果是依靠获取过程或者是资源的再分配的决定。

sentences.english: Of course. Every hotel depends upon the repute of its patrons.
sentences.chinese: 当然啦，每家旅馆都要依靠其主顾的名声。

sentences.english: The miners stayed alive by drinking water that seeped through the earth and were in a stable condition, Wang said.
sentences.chinese: 三位矿工依靠地下不断渗出的水撑了下来，王说。

sentences.english: They decided not to count on foreign aid to relieve the famine.
sentences.chinese: 他们决定不依靠外援来救灾。

sentences.english: Even cattle, which feed on alfalfa, depend on bees.
sentences.chinese: 就连以紫花苜蓿为食的牛也要依靠蜜蜂。

sentences.english: Nor can investment rise to fill the gap.
sentences.chinese: 依靠投资增长来填补空缺也是不可能的。

sentences.english: The profits there are in premium products, buoyed by the seamless ecosystem.
sentences.chinese: 他们在高端产品的利润，依靠着无缝的生态系统。

sentences.english: The plan does, however, depend on American taxpayers stumping up huge amounts of money.
sentences.chinese: 但是，这项计划需要依靠纳税人的钱来保证所需巨资。

definition: to lean against or on/to stand by the side of/to come near to/to depend on/to trust/to fuck (vulgar)/traditional military costume drama where the performers wear armor (old)
to depend on/to be dependent on
to draw support from/with the help of
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on
to exploit/to make use of/to use/to take advantage of/to utilize
assistance/aid/to help/to assist
superiority/dominance/advantage
capability/ability/CL:個|个[ge4]
to maintain/to keep up/to hold together
lack/shortage of/shortfall/to be short (of)/to lack
large/formidable/powerful/strong
itself/oneself/one's own
to rely on/to depend on
by contrast/but as for this.../viewed from another angle/subjectively/introspection
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
see 的士[di1 shi4]
of/~'s (possessive particle)/(used after an attribute)/(used to form a nominal expression)/(used at the end of a declarative sentence for emphasis)
aim/clear
really and truly
